content.json:
# ðŸš€ M365 Audit Log Collector - Monitoring Dashboard

This workbook provides comprehensive monitoring for your M365 audit log collection solution.

---

content.query:
M365AuditCollectionSummary_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| summarize 
    TotalRuns = count(),
    SuccessfulRuns = countif(Success_b == true),
    FailedRuns = countif(Success_b == false),
    AvgDuration = avg(DurationSeconds_d),
    TotalRecords = sum(TotalRecords_d)
| extend 
    SuccessRate = round((SuccessfulRuns * 100.0) / TotalRuns, 2),
    AvgDurationMin = round(AvgDuration / 60, 2)
| project 
    ["Success Rate %"] = SuccessRate,
    ["Total Runs"] = TotalRuns,
    ["Successful"] = SuccessfulRuns,
    ["Failed"] = FailedRuns,
    ["Avg Duration (min)"] = AvgDurationMin,
    ["Total Records"] = TotalRecords

M365AuditCollectionSummary_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| project TimeGenerated, TotalRecords_d, Success_b, DurationMinutes = DurationSeconds_d / 60
| order by TimeGenerated asc

search "M365*_CL"
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where Type !contains "Summary" and Type !contains "Error" and Type !contains "Labels"
| summarize RecordCount = count() by Type
| extend ServiceName = case(
    Type == "M365ExchangeAudit_CL", "ðŸ“§ Exchange",
    Type == "M365SharePointAudit_CL", "ðŸ“ SharePoint",
    Type == "M365TeamsAudit_CL", "ðŸ‘¥ Teams",
    Type == "M365AzureADAudit_CL", "ðŸ” Azure AD",
    Type contains "DLP", "ðŸ›¡ï¸ DLP Events",
    "ðŸ“Š Other"
)
| order by RecordCount desc

union M365*_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where Type !contains "Summary" and Type !contains "Error" and Type !contains "Labels"
| summarize ActivityCount = count() by Operation_s
| order by ActivityCount desc
| take 15

union M365*_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where isnotempty(UserId_s)
| where Type !contains "Summary" and Type !contains "Error" and Type !contains "Labels"
| summarize ActivityCount = count() by UserId_s, UserDisplayName_s, UserDepartment_s
| order by ActivityCount desc
| take 20
| project ["User"] = UserDisplayName_s, ["Department"] = UserDepartment_s, ["Activity Count"] = ActivityCount

M365AzureADAudit_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where Operation_s =~ "UserLoginFailed"
| summarize FailedAttempts = count() by UserId_s, UserDisplayName_s, ClientIP_s
| where FailedAttempts > 3
| order by FailedAttempts desc
| take 10

M365DLP*_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| summarize ViolationCount = count() by PolicyName_s, Severity_s
| order by ViolationCount desc
| take 10

union M365*_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where Type !contains "Summary" and Type !contains "Error" and Type !contains "Labels"
| summarize 
    TotalEvents = count(),
    EnrichedEvents = countif(isnotempty(UserDisplayName_s)),
    DepartmentEnriched = countif(isnotempty(UserDepartment_s)),
    ManagerEnriched = countif(isnotempty(UserManager_s))
| extend 
    EnrichmentRate = round((EnrichedEvents * 100.0) / TotalEvents, 2),
    DepartmentRate = round((DepartmentEnriched * 100.0) / TotalEvents, 2),
    ManagerRate = round((ManagerEnriched * 100.0) / TotalEvents, 2)
| project 
    ["Total Events"] = TotalEvents,
    ["User Enrichment %"] = EnrichmentRate,
    ["Department Info %"] = DepartmentRate,
    ["Manager Info %"] = ManagerRate

M365AuditCollectionErrors_CL
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| summarize ErrorCount = count() by ErrorMessage_s
| order by ErrorCount desc
| take 10

content.json:
---

### ðŸ’¡ Tips for Using This Dashboard

- **ðŸ• Time Range**: Use the time range selector at the top to focus on specific periods
- **ðŸ”„ Refresh**: Click refresh to get the latest data
- **ðŸ“Š Export**: Use the export options to share data with your team
- **ðŸ” Drill Down**: Click on chart elements to filter and drill down into specific data

### ðŸš¨ Key Metrics to Monitor

- **Success Rate**: Should be >95%
- **Duration**: Should be <10 minutes per collection
- **Data Volume**: Monitor for unusual drops or spikes
- **Enrichment Rate**: Should be >90% for internal users

### ðŸ“ž Need Help?

Check the [Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/yourusername/M365-Audit-Log-Collector/blob/main/Documentation/TROUBLESHOOTING.md) for common issues and solutions.
